subject: Education
title: Hangul: The Writing System Designed for the People
description: A quick win: understand Hangul: The Writing System Designed for the People.

hook.text: King Sejong designed Hangul in 1443 so commoners could read. Elites tried to ban it.

buildup.text: Before Hangul, Koreans used Chinese charactersâ€”a system that took decades to learn.

discovery.text: Hangul's letters mirror the shape of the tongue and mouth when making each sound.

twist.text: Scholars condemned it as 'vulgar' because it made literacy accessible to women and peasants.

climax.text: Today, South Korea has one of the highest literacy rates in the world: 99.2%.

punchline.text: The best writing system is the one everyone can learn.

quiz.question: Why was Hangul initially opposed by Korean scholars?
options: It made literacy accessible to common people, threatening the elite's monopoly
It was too difficult to learn
It couldn't represent Korean sounds accurately
